title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: with the PI, questions are related to your research skills and statistics information. your personality and future. Good luck such an easy work if PI was such a good professor
Interview Questions: no specifc questions only related to your research skills

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was no screening call, just one interview with the team directly. It was a Panel interview on Teams with Supply Chain Manager, Supervisor, Recruiter & Supply Chain Director. I had applied directly on the portal
Interview Questions: Describe a time you came up with a create solution.

title: Student Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was professional and focused on resume experience. The questions were related to how previous experience could be applied to the position you're interviewing for. There was 1 interview and a tour of the facility so I could determine my interest in the position.
Interview Questions: Please elaborate on one of your tasks from a previous position.

title: Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back and the manager seemed very conscious that they were interviewing an undergraduate student who was looking to develop skills outside of the classroom. The interview was less than 30 min and most of the questions were about my skills with graphic design and social media.
Interview Questions: What's your preferred graphic design software? How do you stay organized? Please describe your creative process.

title: Helper Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: zoom interview that was kind of short. most of the questions were simple. Felt like the interviewer followed a standard procedure without veering off course too much. would not prepare or study very much for this job
Interview Questions: how are you prepared to work with people of all ages?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screener then an in person interview at the job site where you interviewed with the critical stakeholders. Then you received a call from management informing you of the decision
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: An Initial application with several personality based questions asking about one's perspective in different situations and then there is a follow up interview with 5 questions ask. After that you directly get to hear the result
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why this role

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a staff position. Pleasant experience. Interview panel was knowledgeable and interested. First interview was phone call with the panel where questions asked about my experiences and interest in the position.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your strengths?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy, pleasant and fast. I was able to talk about time management skills within the past experiences I have had. Data analysis and detail-orientation are important. It was conducted on zoom and the interview was at most 45 minutes at minimum 35.
Interview Questions: How is your background relevant to the position?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: First interview was via Zoom, then the second interview was with the hiring team in person. The team took turns asking questions, which were mostly about specifics from the job posting but with a few more general interview questions mixed in.
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of your career

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Less than 10 minutes, mostly about academic background. Research fit matters. Program director will try to match advisor for the first year, if you didn't contact and decide an advisor professor.
Interview Questions: Research fit, admission status of other programs, general preference

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a highly specific and individualized interview, which Depended on the researchers interest. Highly recommend to seek out a researcher who’s interest aligns with yours—it will help a lot in the long run.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in this position?

title: Sales Floor Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initially talked to a member of HR, then the Supervisor in one meeting. Asked basic questions about my resume. Wanted to see if I knew what the job would entail.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions about me

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: They reach you out from the system. and you schedule an interview meeting. After meeting, you get offer or not. Your weekly schedule is important for hiring process.  The hourly rate varies from position to position
Interview Questions: what social activities are you participating during the week

title: Academic Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quickest higher ed interview I’ve ever had. Waited a while between offer and start date, (well over a month) and received a lot of information last minute. It was a stressful onboarding.
Interview Questions: DEI statement, and more job cultural and relational questions.

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Waited maybe a week or two for a call for an interview. Interview was quick. Mostly questions about communication skills.  I  got a call back within that same week and got the offer. I worked at a capped amount of hours because of university rules.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short, around 10 minutes. Consisted of a few questions about previous jobs, your major, course load, and live on or off campus. Very simple and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you fit for this position?

title: Undergraduate Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: This was for an intro biology class. I got asked about my GPA, interest, some basic biology questions, and my availability. Overall, it was short, easy, and not too stressful. Even though I messed up one of the biology questions, they were nice about it and understood interviews are stressful. I was interviewed by the main instructor.
Interview Questions: What is the central dogma of biology?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: SMART questions, short answer prompts. Easy to discuss. Interviewers we’re excellent-friendly and easy to talk to. Had a great time interviewing. Asked me what setting I would like to work in and took into consideration.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you stepped out of your comfort zone.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well done and professional. They created an atmosphere that relates to the job expectations. Overall, I was pleased and eventually got the job. I'd recommend it to a friend
Interview Questions: They asked me to read a script related to the call center

title: Animal Research Liaison Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Westland, MI)
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a Zoom meeting with 5 people.  It was overwhelming and uncomfortable.  They were condescending and rude.  I did not feel welcomed.  It seemed clear to me that I was not of interest to them as an outside candidate.  They asked basic “tell-me-about-yourself” questions but it was clear they were not interested in the answers.  The worst interview I’ve ever had in my 25 years of interviewing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Labor Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: manager called me and asked if i was available for work, very easy process and i began training within a weeks time. training was simple, about 4 hours, and paid.
Interview Questions: i did not have an interview

title: UNIX Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: You go in to speak to the lead lab manager. Once there, you speak regarding your background interests. You might also meet some of the team who will ask you questions based on the work you will have to do.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you don't know how to solve a problem?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Being asked to describe yourself is a very common interview question, and it’s a question that usually comes at the beginning of an interview. You might get a question such as, “What three words best describe you?” or, “Tell me five adjectives that describe your personality.”
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Davis, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Standard academic interview process. First phone interview with the search committee and second virtual onsite interview with a group of people. Waited three weeks and received a phone call from the department chair. I was offered the position and started the start up negotiation processes. This happened in March and April in 2022.
Interview Questions: how are you prepared for teaching, research, and service at MSU?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: very productive your name your age your education degree science course general physics questions how does the cyclemanagements of any product will be done in industrial very productive your name your age your education degree science course general physics questions how does the cyclemanagements of any product will be done in industrial
Interview Questions: generic questions in engineering and communications

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I talked to a professor about my previous research and why I was interested in working for him. He also asked me why I wanted a PhD and what my future career goals are.
Interview Questions: Why do you want a PhD?

title: Assistant Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Total time was about two months and expectations were clear.  Involved two days of meetings and a public presentation.  The first day of meetings included time with the University president, provost, dean, and several directors as well as members of my prospective team.
Interview Questions: How has your previous experience prepared you for this role?

title: College to Career Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions:
People on the search committee are very friendly and very helpful with further explanations. 
I enjoyed talking to them and getting to know their program and school. 
they take a longer time hiring a candidate which I think is very wise because people on both sides can know more about each other.
Interview Questions: what challenges will music students have in the future in terms of career development?

title: Human Resource Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Two on one interview, laid back. Was more of a conversational interview than a technical interview. I enjoyed the process and like the people that were interviewing me! Dont recommend preparing much for the interview
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about a time you went out of your way to help someone else

title: System Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straightforward, courteous and friendly. There was little competition for the position at the time, so I was hired fairly quickly after going over my skills and certifications.
Interview Questions: Experience with Windows and Unix-based networks.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I received an email pertaining to their interest in me and wanting to setup an interview. I have applied for nearly 20 qualified positions at MSU over the years, and this was the first interview request. I responded less than an hour later and they said all of their interview slots were already full...? Twenty days later I received the "Thank you for your interest, but" email.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in participating in a zoom interview?  If so, would you be available next Monday, -------- between noon and 3pm?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick 10 minute interview about my interest in the position, my interest in research, and my experience with children. I essentially applied through handshake in the beginning of the summer and got an interview request two months later. I think I found out I got an offer a few weeks later. The job was flexible and they were willing to pay you which is rare for undergraduate research positions.
Interview Questions: Did I have experience with children.

title: Research Assistant 1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was for the Human Development and Family Studies department. It was only a 10-20 minute interview, but primarily about why I was interested in research and my experience with children. It may have been short because I talked a lot about my interests during the get to know you question.
Interview Questions: Could you tell me more about your experience working with children?

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Plant pathology made the process easy and straightforward to join an established lab and gain experience in a new field where new skills could be honed. PI's role in the interview was easy to talk to and very straightforward.
Interview Questions: What is your experience learning new software in application with your work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to the position and it was an online interview. PI asked questions related to long-term and short-term goals and also about my availability. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What are my long term and short term goals

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: General questions but committee members may ask some specific questions, depends on committee members. Usually four members in committee and chair asked five general questions. Nice people, no pressure and everything went well
Interview Questions: what is your main achievement

title: Website Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great communication and interview within days of applying. Knew if I had the position a couple of days after interviewing. Been a great time since working there. Slay slay slay!
Interview Questions: What is your major right now?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was satisfied with the interview process and the office staff was friendly and open. I was very comfortable during the interview and they questions were simple and straightforward. I am glad I interviewed for the job
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It's a computer science class TA. Due to covid it's online zoom meeting and it's super convenient and easy. Basically after they view your profile and resume, if that looks good than they will hire you immediately.
Interview Questions: Use Big O notation to describe QuickSort.

title: Data Analytics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I received an email asking for an interview.  I set it up on line the date and time.  It was a phone call, very professional  lasted about 35 - 40 minutes
Interview Questions: Wanted to understand my detail  knowledge of different data analytic software.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted cv, cover letter and 3 recommendation letter, had an interview with the direct supervisor. Interviewed with few other department members, held a seminar based on previous work once short listed.
Interview Questions:
Why would you want to work here?
Describe a difficult problem from a previous job and your solution.
What can you bring to the team?

title: IT College of Education Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 30 mins long and was mostly information about the job. The only questions were about experience. The interviewer is your boss and he seems like a strict guy. He specifically said that you had to do stuff his way and that you can't deviate from his instructions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with computers?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Met with two people that worked in the lab! They asked me to tell them about myself, about my work habits, and how much time I could commit to the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous research experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super easy and informal. Looked at my CV and told me I had the job. I was able to determine my own hours as a student which was valuable for me. I gained massive skill in Excel and data collection/analysis.
Interview Questions: Why do you see yourself in plant breeding?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a very typical interview process. I had a phone interview  with the Director of the department, and then was offered an on campus interview with other colleagues in the department.
Interview Questions: Average interview questions: Strengths/weaknesses, why are you interested in this position, etc.

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Just a simple application process along with an interview containing STAR format questions. Also some basic questions on who I am and my relation to the university and why I applied for the position
Interview Questions: Q: Describe time you had to make a time sensitive decision

title: Undergraduate Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward questions regarding programming and OOP concepts. Many of the questions involved general python, pandas for data analysis or sci-kit learn machine learning. There were also questions involving general logic.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would go about drawing a triangle using python

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: They call you and then zoom with you going over qualities and experiences. Also, it is interactive with other candidates where they have you participate in different activities that require creativity and quick thinking.
Interview Questions: Tell me about some challenges you faced and how you overcame them

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy. They hired me when I had a AS in Applied Science and supported me working for my BS is computer science when I worked. The interview process consisted of a few simple questions and did not have any curve balls.
Interview Questions: How do you update a webpage without refreshing it using jQuery.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Awesome Place to work with amazing health benefits for parents and the family. Better than the University of Michigan in terms of the research environment and how people behave around you in general
Interview Questions: Field-specific phone discussion followed by lab meeting

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy if you are a student. Demonstrate that you have work ethic and customer service skills. The two biggest things to communicate is your attitude and effort. This is a great opportunity to work in college and they will always work around class scheduling.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked with a team to overcome an obstacle

title: Student Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 15 minute interview over Microsoft Teams (at least right now, due to COVID). Asked questions like my employment history and scripted questions about if you've been in a certain situation and how you handled it (a conflict with a classmate, group project, etc.)
Interview Questions: Can you recall a time when you were in a situation where you didn't get along with someone in a team setting? How did you handle it?

title: Undergraduate Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked about skills regarding multiple different processes that would be taught during the course.  Went over what an everyday class would be like to see if it would be a good fit. Asked why I wanted to be a undergraduate learning assistant.
Interview Questions: How would you rank your debugging skills?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was designed to identify and narrow down your research interests.  Over all experience was possitive and interviewer stressed the importance that this interview was ment to get to know you rather than to interigate you.
Interview Questions: What are your research areas of interest in linguistics?

title: Graduate Assistant for Outreach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively short and straightforward. After submitting an application, I attended Spartan Preview Days and had several interviews with different organization. They got back to me within 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to collect information?

title: Student Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Typical, Awesome and the people are good people. They look out for employees and understand that we are just undergrads. They just ask a few questions and that is it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews, During COVID was all virtual zoom based with department heads, faculty staff and a few grad students. This made a potential move very difficult. Interviewers were respectful and gracious with their time.
Interview Questions: What is your Teaching style?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. They call you to schedule the interview. During the interview they ask basic questions about you, your interest in working there as well as your skills and what you can  contribute to the team
Interview Questions: They asked me tell about my goals in life

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great interviews with the whole team over the span of 3-4 months. After all of this once I gave my last round, I didn't hear back for a month after which I was told they weren't hiring then. Felt like a waste of time and a huge downer
Interview Questions: What is my exposure in public and private investments

title: Enrollment Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three different groups of team members from the International Center. It was a bit daunting to interview with so many people, but they were affable and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Q: How could you use your past experience to benefit the team?

title: Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I arrived 10 minutes early and we were able to start early. She asked me 5 or 6 questions and it took around 10 min. She contacted me a few days later through email and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in agricultural sustainability?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy process. It was completed in less than 3 weeks. Would recommend applying. Heard Back from the hiring officer very quickly and questions were answered promptly. I would recommend applying online
Interview Questions: How did you overcome a past difficulty

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Durham, NC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: PI gave a phone call interview and ask several questions and ask why you like this position and offer the salary  rank. I also did some description about my current research.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard, with a strong focus on the STAR(L) Format (Situation, Task, Action, Result, Lessons Learned). Review with your RA beforehand, and highlight not only how you give back to the community, either MSU or other, but how you are still a student and you are learning--in academics, diversity and inclusion, time management, whatnot.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time in which you encountered an obstacle?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful process where we were asked to display problem solving skills, cultural competence, and a desire to help others. The process involved questions in the STAR format where we needed to say what we’d done in certain situations or what we would do.
Interview Questions: What is one word you’d use to describe yourself?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I did not really have to go through an interview process. My supervisor during my undergraduate research project contacted me asking if I would like to join the PhD program after graduation
Interview Questions: if I wanted to join the phd program after doing some research as an undergraduate student

title: Senior Database Administrator (DBA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Michigan State University recruiters were very professional and on time.

The whole interview process was very smooth, though so many questions.
They have many Oracle databases and MSU is Oracle-centric Organization.
The interviewer was very polite about the process.
Thank you!
Interview Questions: Mostly generic Oracle DBA questions

title: Associate Dean for Diversity & Campus Inclusion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was two rounds of interviews with a Zoom interview after the initial application screening and then an all-day, on-campus interview in East Lansing. It was a very thorough and engaging experience that I fully enjoyed.
Interview Questions: A question I was asked was how I would handle a senior level officer that was known for making inappropriate comments to other colleagues and female students.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was nice and the people were so humble. It is 3 round interview and the first one is a cultural fit and the 2nd one is a behavioural/personal with technical questions. 3rd not yet
Interview Questions: tell me more about yourself?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process via initial phone call  followed with a face to face interview with the hiring team. overall a pleasant experience, not too hard. Nothing to worry about, just be yourself and tell what qualities you have.
Interview Questions: Why would we hire you?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: No interview were done for this hiring. Simply spoke to a professor and asked shall there be any opportunities to assist him/her in their project. If they said yes, then they will extend a temporary employment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Editor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and efficient. I met with the entire team, not just the boss, in a conference room. Each took turns asking me questions about grammar and some SEO stuff. It was nice to be able to meet people I'd potentially be working with, instead of just those in charge.
Interview Questions: To complete a short editing assignment during the interview.

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an email asking for an interview about a month after I sent in my application. The interview was with a 3-person panel where they each took turns asking questions. At the end of the interview, I was told that they would be in contact within a week, two at the latest. It has now been five weeks with no response, yet their recruiter responds. It’s pretty annoying to not even get a “no, we went with someone else” after interviewing.
Interview Questions: General technical/behavioral questions

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was nice as the lady was nice. Just asked general questions about problem solving and working with others. Also very open to other obligations and school. Very understanding
Interview Questions: What is a problem you’ve had to overcome

title: Marketing and Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, simple, and low stress. At the time, they were looking for someone who could assist in creating a lot of social channels content as well as interview researchers.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with juggling multiple tasks or projects at once?

title: Level IV Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was based on the S.T.A.R method like any other job the questions dealt with customers,  leading a crew and tuff situations. I was interviewed by Managers and HR. I went through training.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were in a tuff situation, how did you handle it?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process for this job as a customer service representative which is placed in east landing Michigan and is a job that is held at Michigan state university was that the interview was tedious and have to know your stuff and be informative on the job at hand.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was clear they were going to hire a preselected internal candidate and only needed “outside” candidates to check the compliance box.  One interviewer even joked about it.  What a waste of everyone’s time.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you want to work at Michigan State University

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: apply to graduate school, get accepted, go on visits and meet with potential advisors. Select what school you want to go to. Interviews only necessary if you are coming from out of the united states
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process, it took over 2 months from the time I submitted my application to the time I received an offer. First I did a 3 person panel phone interview, which involved many generic questions and a couple technical questions. Around 2-3 weeks after the phone interview I did a 4 person panel in person interview, which involved more generic questions but also quite a few hypothetical technical questions. Overall the interviews were a good experience, just don’t expect the hiring process to be quick.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you struggled to get information from a colleague and how you resolved the issue.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It basically depends on what your qualification and experience is with respect to the course you are going to be teaching. Interview is relatively easy. Good grades in the course previously helps.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have in this course and how confident are you in teaching this course?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic EE questions from undergraduate courses, what is my future career goal either academic or industrial. I asked about how the research process is going, how is the life and work balance. Can I do interns during the summer.
Interview Questions: Have you used MATLAB and other lab equipment like multimeter or VNA

title: Student Infotech Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emailed to come in for an interview. Had an interview with panel in person. The panel asked series of questions and only lasted 15 minutes or 30 minutes. Very laod back and low key.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with supporting users?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
* A team question (How you have worked with a team or a struggle you faced when working with a team)
* Walk through resume (Elevator Pitch)
* MOST IMPORTANT - Make sure you present your answers in STAR format 
- Situation, Task, Action, Result
If the interviewer cannot follow along with you on their templet there is a high chance they will think of your interview answers as messy even if it makes sense.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with a team to achieve a goal

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick and informal. I was taken into a room with whom I'd be working for and we reviewed my resume.  Furthermore, I was asked a couple more in depth questions about my resume and asked to apply these experiences to hypothetical situations.
Interview Questions: Can you highlight a time when you may have had to deal with a difficult customer?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 1-3 days several interviews with each admin you will work with/under Paperwork: transcripts, CV, cover letter, teaching examples, Research presentation Teaching presentation Interview discussions with Chair, Dean, and important faculty members, as well as students
Interview Questions: if hired, what are your goals for your time working at MSU?

title: Student Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview and onboarding process was simple, and performed via an online portal, and group onboarding respectively. Most questions were typical, and performed via a series of quizzes. The questions were mostly survey questions and scenarios about how you would perform on the job.
Interview Questions: As far as I remember, most questions were self-explanatory, about what would be your logical reaction in an on-the-job situation, and requests about which position you wish to fill in the RHS system.

title: Service Center Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Awful STAR format interview where they ask you drawn out questions and grade your answer right in front of you. Doesn’t matter how you are at the job, only thing that matters is how you interview. Feels like an exam.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult experience you had with a coworker and how you resolved it.

title: Manager Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple questions, mainly availability and basic cleaning skills. This is before covid so the interview was in person. Met with the manager of facilities and also the director of the union
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with banquet setting and events?

title: Administrative Assistant (QA) Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Michigan Mills, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: few behavioural questions then went to technical questions. It was with one other person who i think was HR person. some of the behaviour questions included experiences regarding with previous co-op/internship
Interview Questions: what are some aspects in quality testing a water bottle

title: ILS Student Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply on website, then someone from HR will email you for an interview.  Interview itself is laid back and doesn't have any hard questions. If you are hired they will take you to meet with another HR person to provide personal info for administrative purposes.
Interview Questions: What previous work experience do you have?

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Long interview.  Group setting.  Each person took turn interviewing me.  A lot of repeated questions.  Which made for a long interview.  They were very prepared for the interview and were well set up.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: It actually wasn't much of an interview; just toured the library and was hired. Maybe I got lucky, but I spent 4 amazing years here. My supervisor was great, and I got to work for various departments.
Interview Questions: What days are you available to work?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took a couple of weeks. We did a phone interview, and I spoke to two members of the team on which I would be working.  They asked almost no questions to clarify anything on my resume,  just some pretty general questions about how I work in a team; meeting deadlines; etc. Then they left some time for me to ask questions and clarified the day-to-day of the position a bit. The whole interview was not very personal, but friendly.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time that you failed to do something.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy going process, took about a week in total. Had a phone interview and was hired on the spot after. Just had a few questions about my studies and prior expierence.
Interview Questions: What are you currently studying at MSU?

title: Student Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It was amazing! They make you very comfortable and set you up for success 
The school generally prides itself in that and lives up to it 
would recommend any student to interview for this job
Interview Questions: How do work best within a team

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I originally applied online and was contacted about two months later. The interview was not very long. It lasted approximately 15-20 minutes. I was offered a position a week later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you set a goal and went out to achieve it?

title: Data Migration Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick 10 minute phone call interview. The process was quick and their hiring process was also pretty fast. It was mainly an easy phone interview about behavioral questions mainly and one technical question at the end but the person interviewing me didn't even require me to answer it since he said my entire interview went well.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions and the last question was "technical". "If you had a PB&J sandwich, what are the steps you'd take to make it in a minute?"

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: For Residence Education and Housing Services, Outreach Department. There were 3 people interviewing and all of them are friendly. Most of the questions are STAR questions (a question which begins with "Tell us about a time when you had........"
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had had to work or spend a significant amount of time with someone from a different background or who had different values than you. How did you manage that situation and what did you learn from it?

title: Information Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Went through a process of several pages of technical questions alongside talking about yourself.  They asked several questions about myself and work ethic, then started the technical process. The process was very simple and straightforward and was challenging due  to the technical questions
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about yourself

title: Level I Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: S.T.A.R. based interview that asked you to describe the Situation (S), Task (T), Action (A), and Result (R). There were various other random questions that depend on the interviewer.
Interview Questions: Describe the Situation (S), Task (T), Action (A), and Result (R)?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions, easy hiring process. It was raining behavioral based questions. Some of the questions included asking about past work experience, and different times you worked in a team or took initiative. Overall it was a basic interview for an entry level position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you worked independently.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Flawless, by the book interview. Got asked specific questions about why I wanted to study what I study and my long term career goals. Very straight forward. The interviewers helped me understand the process and left almost no ambiguity.
Interview Questions: Why this field? Why a PhD? Why MSU? What are your career goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Flint, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward and offered out of school. It was a relaxed environment that ended up being quite useful! I met with my soon to be boss for talks of getting an internship, but was quickly hired in!
Interview Questions: 1) Describe your processes 2) Describe your familiarity with this subject

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal for a postdoc position. Mostly one on one with PI with half an hour presentation of your PhD work followed by question answers. THen you get a chance to ask questions to PI
Interview Questions: research presentation, mostly research talks

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty simple and straight forward, panel interview with about five panelist--typical questions about higher ed and advising experience with questions about advising theories, initiative and situation based questions. Ive been on interview committees for other departments and they are typical like this. Usually one interview and an offer is made.
Interview Questions: What has been your experience with underrepresented students?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Starts online and you get a phone call. Interview over the phone and if you pass that, they will schedule you and in person interview on campus. Once you meet on campus, they ask you several questions. Some are math based. If they like you, you get the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you provided an outstanding service?

title: Logistics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, apply and get good job, just a lovely company to work for.  just marvelous. happy happy happy, super happy.  OVER ALL BLESSED.  Good job, good place to work, good enviornment
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Information Technologist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  After a MONTH, I was contacted for a phone screening.  It went well, I was informed they had additional interviews to perform the next week.  That is fine.  I expected to hear, one way or another, within a week or week and a half of my screening.  Nothing.  I followed up after two weeks of waiting.  Nothing.  It is fine if they didn't pick me, but I just find it rude and inconsiderate that they cannot inform the people that didn't make it to the next round.
Interview Questions: How will your experience benefit this position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4 people. Asked me real life, relevant questions that pertain to the job. It was semi-relaxed and gave me a chance to not feel too uptight and nervous. I was called a few days later for a second interview and the job was then offered.
Interview Questions: You come from an unrelated field, why should we pick you?

title: Incident Response Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I applied in Late June for this position.  A month or so later I received an email that asked me to give times for an in-person interview. I had an interview 2 weeks later. I met with one HR member and 3 members of the Incident Response team. In addition to many typical interview questions a logic test was also administered. All members of the panel were very nice. 6 days after my interview, I received an email informing me the position was cancelled.
Interview Questions: What security news materials do you read?

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied through REHS. Received an email briefly after. The process of getting in and starting to train took a little over a month. The interview was easy. Study the STAR method. Prepare before going in, think of scenarios and questions they may ask.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to complete a task within a tight deadline. Describe the situation, and explain how you handled it.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone call first interview. They will call back to setup formal interview with manager of the department. Usual interview process asking scripted questions overall easy and friendly process. Office skills test is also required typing, reading,
Interview Questions: basic tell me about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lunch with the group, in a restaurant, very friendly and informal. We negotiate further for salary, obligations, and expectations from both sides.  People from the group also asked questions and were interested in my personality.
Interview Questions: About my lab experience, project discussion

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process didnt happen. I did not receive an interview and was hired on the spot because I was a student in the class. Positions like this are available in courses that you like/do well in.
Interview Questions: Nothing was asked of me

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: They tested our CPR abilities and administered an aquatic test to test for swimming ability, rescue ability and scanning the pool. This was over a several hour period, where people would be eliminated if they failed any rounds of testing.
Interview Questions: What my school schedule was for that semester

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview loop with multiple faculty and technical staff. The loop included around 15 employees, each lasting 20-30 minutes. Interviews included technical questions, equipment demonstrations and career goal discussion, followed by 1 hr presentation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research, and explain the challenges and successes you faced.

title: General Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: really simple interview, just ask why you want to work in here. And the legal status in USA. And many documents need to fill in order to work in MSU
Interview Questions: your legal statue in USA

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy they just offer you the position due to your performance in high school. There really isn't much of a interview related to any of the hiring process. I don't know much else to say on the topic.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: FRIB Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Job submission is web based attach your cover letter and resume then enter most of that data again in the submission form. Once you do it once it's done for any other submissions. Phone interview asking very technical questions some of them relevant some of them seem to have been lifted from a question bank. Answered about 65% with some level of fluency. Was frankly surprised to hear back from them to have the face to face. So no need to sweat the technical interview as much as you would think.  Face to face was great pretty large number of folks some of them technical some of them not. One person led the question section and a few put their two cents in. Most of them nice a few a little more aggressive. Nothing advesarial. Left in a good place all around. Good folks with an interesting mission.
Interview Questions: Basic linux admin questions, Computer security in regards to network security. Pretty low level networking questions. Ports on firewall, switches, switching & routing theory. What attracted you to this job, weaknesses, knowledge of the problem area they are working on.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Thought-out process but did not drag out the time line. Were very open about what they wanted from an employee and made sure they were very clear about what they were not looking for.
Interview Questions: How can you balance work like and school?

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: STAR format in front of student supervisors and operations manager. they take turns asking you questions and allow you time to develop a story that fits the scenario while following the situation, task, action and result format.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to overcome an issue at school or work.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application and was invited to interview. Spent a day meeting faculty and having lunch with current students to better understand the program and fit.  Culture is very important and although it appeared to be a good fit at the outset, once there I realized I had chosen the wrong department.
Interview Questions: What are your long term research interests and goals.

title: Field/Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Gull Lake, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. The entire meeting was roughly an hour long. 30 minutes explaining the various projects our lab works on, and 30 minutes going over your resume and explaining aspects of yourself and your past experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: A very lengthy process from start to finish--included a phone screen and then a panel interview. It can vary by department interviewing you though. For most people it can take months before you hear anything and sometimes you are not notified at all. It is a very competitive process to say the least. Each interview has been very helpful in sharpening my interview skills. Sometimes Human Resources directly selects the applicants for the department and sometimes the department chooses who they will interview. Either way it is a very lengthy process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your role on a team. . .

title: Game Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was informal. It did not require any preperation other than for me to submit my resume and show my previous work experience with unity. This was for an on campus internship as a game software engineer.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with unity?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Rochester, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I have interview with Ally, asked my about some basic question. Briefly talk about some question about my project. Some basic question about my past experience on my resume. he Microsoft Learning Strategy and Insights team within the Worldwide Learning group is composed of insatiably curious, self-directed, motivated, results driven people.
Interview Questions: What is logistic regression

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was amazing very well conducted. I got along well with the interviewer and they made me feel very comfortable while we spoke about the position. I can say that it was an overall pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 2 years

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Just know that if someone's kid, spouse, or sibling needs a job, you lose. It doesn't matter that their degree is in biology and they have no experience and this is an HR job. The daughter-in-law will get it because she can't find another job nearby. Be smarmy and do not demand too much of any subordinate that has a relative in HR, because they can and will keep you off interview lists. This place is going to get whiter and whiter and I would suggest, lazier and lazier.
Interview Questions: Are you a web master? (note the job posting did not mention this as a recommended or requirement).

title: Animal Caretaker I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online (they don't post publicly very often). Heard through email not too long after for in person interview. Interviewed with the Operations Supervisor and another Supervisor. I believe it was a few days later I was asked to come back to meet with a different Supervisor and another "higher up". I was driven to see one of the facilities and sent on my way. I got a phone call the next day (after leaving an interview for completely different job) and the job offer. Then I got an email of when to be expected. I think the entire process up to my first official day was 3-4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with conflict and how you handled it

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is very behavioral but also focuses on the fun side of life as a student at MSU.  One of the  things is that they want to see how you interact with other applicants because that is a main parts of the job.
Interview Questions: If you could only show one location on campus to prospective students, what would it be?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was contacted for an interview three months later by HR. I sat down with a five person panel for a little over an hour and was asked routine questions to get a feel for how I problem solve. The panel ranged from a person with the same title I was interviewing for up to senior management. I was then given an offer two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Whats the difference between purchasing within a private company vs a government facility?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral and experience overview. Went over behavioral questions and then my resume. Showed them past experience that was applicable to the position. Located in breslin, dealing with vendors that run the concessions stands at each game.
Interview Questions: Name a time you encountered difficulty in a group scenario?

title: Surplus Store Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief, to the point questions, but included a tour that took a while. They look for any real job experience, preferably in a commercial/warehouse environment. Also need to be able to out up with the red tape of MSU.
Interview Questions: Any type of job experience? Preferably commercial environment

title: Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted CV and letters of reference. Interviewed by HR and Supervisor.  Met with each of the Supervisors, approximately five other administrators and answered questions about skill, abilities and challenges.  Returned for second interview.
Interview Questions: How the position fit into longterm career goals

title: Extension Educator Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview about seven people. They each asked questions I answered.  My advice study something about the organization. Ask how many will interview you. Prior to that I had a phone interview that took a few minutes with one person.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you handled a conflict between coworkers

title: Information Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied, and heard from someone via email about 3 weeks later, was scheduled for an interview the next week. When I arrived, they had someone waiting for me in the parking lot with a parking pass. She then asked to ride in my car, in order to show me where to park (which was unprofessional). It was a 4 person panel interview, and they promised a follow up either way by the following week. Never got anything. Felt that this was very unprofessional, and the communication is lackluster, at best.
Interview Questions: Are you more of an individual worker, or collaborater? Why?

title: Teaching Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going, no difficult questions at all.  The interview include lunch with students, dinner with faculty.  One on one interview with several faculty and staff members from the department.  It last from early morning till late evening.  All questions are fair and reasonable.
Interview Questions: How do you use learning objectives?

title: Media and Digitization Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked a few basic questions before being considered for the position. I was called in to meet with the hiring supervisor. Upon entering the supervisor took me to the back to discuss what the digital media center is and what they do at the library.  He explained what I would be doing if I were hired and he went on to ask a few questions about me.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the Digital Media center?

title: Media Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the person that I would be working for, and spoke with him for about a half hour about my schedule and abilities to troubleshoot technology issues. It wasn't really an interview so much as an introduction, due to a friend's referral. Pretty easy job.
Interview Questions: Are you good with computers?

title: Cafeteria Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't difficult, very casual.  The only bad part was that they asked very generic questions. If you just look up interview questions online any of them will be asked.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Sparty's Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a call around 3 months later. Interview was very brief around 10 minutes. If i didn't drag my answers it could have finished within 5 minutes  The interview was basically to make sure you're not very stupid. I interviewed with a student "manager." I received an offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job, then had a small phone interview with the head coach before I was brought to campus for multiple meetings with different individuals in the department.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with your head coach.

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Detroit, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend of mine since college to apply for this job, It took 5 weeks to process my application. Then, I was scheduled for an interview with a panel of 5 people. I received an accept offer 3 weeks after the interview date. I love where I am working for now. All colleagues are nice, helpful.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was emailed about coming in for an interview, the communication was very unorganized. I was told to come to a room at a certain time and there was a meeting going on at that place and time. There was even someone presenting so i left. Turns out their meeting was the setting for the interview and it ended up being a surprise group interview.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you had to perform tedious work?

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Video interview, followed by an inperson interview.  Took a long time to set everything up.  The actual interview was standard compared to most interviews.  I accepted the job, but could not negotiate on salary.
Interview Questions: Life questions and questions relating to job / technical skills.

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick and painless interview, took a while to hear feedback. Panel of 3 people reviewing my resume and asking questions. Early morning interview at the office held in their conference room, didn't start until well after the scheduled time which heightened my nerves.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after graduation? Are you okay with doing tedious mundane tasks?

title: Union Qsr Crew Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: one of the HR asked me few questions about normal things would appear in interview; then i just answered them honestly, it's nor hard interview, what they want is that you can lead other staffs and get the job done
Interview Questions: why would you want to apply this position?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I found the position ad through some professional website and submitted directly to the professor who posted the position. After one month, I got a phone interview with him. I mainly asked my research history and achievements. In the end, he asked me provide three references. After another three weeks, he called me and accepted my application. The offer preparation took almost two months because some key person which needed to sign the offer were in vacation.
Interview Questions: All relate to the research projects which I did before.

title: Student Labor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interview to see if you could do the work. Job wasn't very hard so they didn't need a lot of qualifications. Ended up just talking about random things in the store.
Interview Questions: How many hours are you willing to work?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: If you would like to attend graduate school, I would strongly suggest contacting a prospective advisor BEFORE applying to the program.  Many programs will not even consider accepting a student unless a faculty member in the department in the department has already committed to supporting them.
Interview Questions: Do you plan on working another job while pursuing your PhD?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I have gotten both research positions from emailing people I was interested in collaborating with and could see potential for the future.  My resume mainly spoke for itself, my interview was brief, and then I was given a tour of the lab space and further explained my responsibilities. I basically knew from the interview that I had secured the position
Interview Questions: Basics about my interests, knowledge in the area I'd be working, seeing myself down the road after college, and anything else I'd like to include.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: General questions you get in every interview. Past work experience, where do you see yourself in 5 years, why should we hire you, what are some of your flaws. Just be genuine and transparent. If you are a student they will ask your gpa, major, ect.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work experiences

title: Telecom Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. I was there for well over an hour. About half way through I realized it would be a poor fit as I did not have several of the skills required for the job. However, I still answered all questions and thanked everyone for their time. Everyone was extremely nice and seemed interested in what I had to say. I sent follow up thank you notes to all concerned. However, what concerned me was I never received any feedback saying I was not chosen. I didn't expect to know why I wasn't hired but I expected an email saying "sorry, position has been filled"  If you are chosen/complete an interview it would just be common courtesy. I felt this was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Asked about experiences at former job.

title: Interlibrary Loan Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three of the supervisors from the ILL department who asked me about problems I've solved and other kinds of behavioral questions. They were very nice and got back to me soon.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to do something that you hadn't done before.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long tedious, but very personable. I enjoyed the process and learned more information about the university. There were some tough questions that were asked but it was how do you apply these principals to the students.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Welcome Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jan 2016
