Interview Descriptions: Very easy. They basically ask you why you want the job. They want to make sure that you’re who your resume says you are. Just be personable and make sure they know you want to help welcome incoming/potential future Spartans.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your customer service experience.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through school website and was contacted by the professor.  Overall the process was very quick with and lasted about 1 week total.  Professor was looking for individuals that have taken their class before and could elaborate on specific instances where the excelled in the course.
Interview Questions: How would you balance your classwork with preparing for the class that you will teach?

title: Engagement Center Peer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: There are two people interviewing you with some questions. It's quite easy if you can deliver what you have done before. Don't forget to mention the willingness that you can take extra responsibility in the future.
Interview Questions: Would you describe yourself?

title: Loan Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was very smooth. i applied for multiple other jobs, but if you dont have in your application the information they are looking for in the job description you wont even get past the robots to get an interview which took me a little bit to figure out.
Interview Questions: Is there any type of person you dont like to talk to? If so, could you please state which kind of person and why?

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview that took a maximum of ten minutes.  I got a call a couple days later saying I got the job and all I needed to do was come in a fill out paperwork.
Interview Questions: Name a goal and how you achieved it?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
why msu
future plan
do you often late for job
why leave former employergood location, beautiful scenery, good work environment, get along well with coworkers, graduated from msu, familiar with the environment
a situation when you leader a team and settle a conflict
a situation when you face obstacle
a situation when you establish a relationship with others
Interview Questions: why msu

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the university website and I got a call about a week later. They gave me a short phone interview to see if there were specific days I could work. After that they asked if I could come in and talk with the other managers. It was a very relaxing interview, they asked about other hobbies I have and what I know about computers. It only lasted about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Can you name different types of display cables?

title: Book Department Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a easy and friendly interview with three staff members, it took less than an hour and they even gave me a tour of the facilities! They made me feel very comfortable and there was no uneasiness at all.
Interview Questions: They asked about previous jobs I've had and which ones I preferred.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process is very simple. Nearly all of the questions are straight forward questions. Nothing too stress too much over.  They are just looking to see if you are a compatible fit with the operation.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you took initiative.

Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Ten minute interview with three members of management. I was asked basic questions about experience, how I would handle certain situations, etc. I provided copies of my resume to them and we went over it and discussed it.

title: Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid-back. It was only a student interview, so it was lower pressure than a full-time position interview. Most of the questions were thoughtful and relevant to the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with publishing?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Perfect, just as i would hope any interview would be. They took me back into an office and had a worksheet to read interview questions off of and i answered the questions the best i could.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness

title: Student Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I contacted my potential employer online, send a resume and got a reply within 2 days approximately. The interview lasted for about 40 mins
Interview Questions: What are your qualifications for x position?

title: Sparty's Operatoins Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. It was extremely hard to get an interview even though I was told on many accounts by other managers that I was over qualified for the position. The manager for this position did not return my phone calls and emails until a fellow student/employee continuously reminded him. Interview was quick and basically asked when I could start.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join out team?

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview for Dining Services was very brief and easy interview, I applied in person and then got the job after the short interview. They went over the resume and asked about my past experience.
Interview Questions: Standard

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in person with the OC and a student supervisor. Was called into the OC's office at a time that worked for me.  Started with basic questions, I.E. work experience and reasons for applying. Went on to situational prompts. Apparently they always ask interviewees if they would still be interested even if they took away the 'homework at the desk' privilege.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a parent came to the desk demanding something to be done?

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: Ten minute interview, basic questions at first, then they turn into STAR questions.  They give a vague scenario. You prove the Situation, the Task at hand, the Action you took, and the Results.
Interview Questions: We don't always get things right. Please let us know one time you had overlooked a detail.  What happened and what was the result?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions:
it was a simple chat. we met at the office and we went over my resume. We first began with a behavioral type interview where we talked about what I liked to do for fun, and what I am studying at school. It was really easy going.

Then we talked about my resume. We went over the various projects and discussed my love for data analytics, and talked about how I could be a good fit for the role that was open.
Interview Questions: What technical projects have you worked in?

title: Mechanical Design Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got an email from the manager to set up an interview day and time; It was a conference interview where i was being asked by three of the engineer there;they did not take a long time to respond
Interview Questions: What skills do you have relate to design?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Standard hiring process. There was a long application that comes out in November with multiple essays. Make sure to talk to an RA that is currently working to help read and go through your application. They then weed people out if they do not me a cumulative 2.75 GPA after that semester. After that most people go on to the interview. The interview process does not change and it is a very poor process. Applicants only get 2 interviews and only one of those (the one with the Community Director) really matter. There is also a group process, but that really does not matter just don't do anything stupid in that interview (like use a weapon or something). In order to guarantee yourself a position make sure you suck up to the Community Director in the neighborhood or dorm you want to work. Otherwise it can be a crap shoot. They will notify you in 3 weeks from when you interview. Good Luck and if you don't get it, realize that there are better places to work on campus OR feel free to try again next year.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you encountered a situation that was challenging for you. What did you do?

title: Student Technical Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after I saw a position at my msu spdc site. Then I sent an email to contact the project manager. He replied by saying he liked my resume and wants to meet with me for an interview. I went there in formals and then we started the interview soon after I reached the office. There were two people who were interviewing me but they were both nice and friendly. At the end of the interview they said that They will let me know soon.
Interview Questions: Do you anything about doors?

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview

Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict with team members?

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Service Center Representative Interview

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Was referred for the position by a friend. Sent my resume to MSU and heard back within a few days. Laidback environment and a lot of autonomy to do your job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous work experience

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2015

title: Engineering Mentor Interview

Interview Questions:
Am I used to working with people? 
What leadership experience have I had in the past? 
Am I comfortable in high-stress environments? What are some examples of time's I've been in such an environment, and how did I react?

title: AOP Employee (Part Time) Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied and received an e-mail about two weeks later saying to come to Hannah Admin to set up a date for an interview. I did so, went to the interview and heard back by that Friday through an e-mail! Very laid back interview! The interview was conducted by students who work for AOP, not faculty. With that being said, it was not very intimidating. I talked about spring break with the interviewer in small talk. The questions were pretty straight forward most being from the application. There were a few odd ball questions like the one I listen that threw me off, but I think they are just trying to get a feel for the type of person you are. I wore a blouse, black skirt and black dress shoes. Not bad at all!
Interview Questions: If you are late to work and see a hurt dog on the side of the road, what would you do?

,

Interview Descriptions: Used Venture.com to find out about position. Then I emailed my resume and cover letter to the PI. After about a day I heard back and was able to schedule an interview. The interview was very science based. She asked about my previous research experience and wanted a detail account of what I did. She also asked about a few of the techniques I was going to be doing and my level of familiarity. I knew some but the rest I only knew theoretically which for some odd reason made her excited. So, I would say be honest about what you know and what you don't know. They want to be able to teach you but it would help if you knew a little about the techniques before hand.
Interview Questions: Questions were relatively easy. A lot of previous research questions and a few behavioral questions.

title: Consultant, Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: The process of interviewing for this position was interesting. The entire interview was a three hour interview that included three segments. First, there was a group interview that was mostly traditional. Two people interviewed me and I was the only one in this interview. They were obviously using a rating system and it was very organized. Next, I was asked to go to a different room and I was to look over a wide variety of data and then asked to role-play with two school personnel about how I could help them improve test results. Finally, I was asked to go to yet another room where I was given a list of questions to pick from and I had to provide a writing sample by responding to the question I chose. A very large number of people were interviewed for the positions and many different people were involved in the interview process over a two week period. I found the process to be very organized given the large number of people interviewed and given the many different MSU people doing the interviewing.
Interview Questions: Actually, nothing about the interview stands out as difficult or unexpected except the actual process.

title: Financial Aid Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview - nothing to difficult at all. Mainly behavioral and situational based questions to get a feel of how you would handle different scenarios. Like most other interviews, you will be asked to talk over your resume and explain how your experience may be beneficial to the job.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict with a customer?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Some good benefits - discounted product, lots of PTO once you've put in a few years, ESPP and profit share/match are great. Great child care centers. Flexible work hours and telecommuting available. Lots of lip service to work/life balance - in the right group you may even experience it (I do). Casual atmosphere and culture.
Interview Questions: Why MSU

title: Extension Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: After application was referred to the department, I participated in a group phone interview. After making it to the final round I had an inperson interview which included a public presentation.
Interview Questions: What is your perspective on getting youth and adult volunteers involved in civic activities?

title: Secretary II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted with a panel of all the immediate personnel that I would be working with. A packet of questions were provided that I had to answer and the panel members that asked each question would alternate. The entire interview took approximately 2 hours. Within this time, this included the panel asking specific questions, follow up questions, and potential scenarios that I would need to respond to. That latter part of the interview involved a skills test that was not timed but how long you took was observed.
Interview Questions: Q: Why would this department within the university be a good fit for your skill set?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Interview Process was divided up into three parts. The first part was a group interview. The group interview was an activity which allows current staff to see how one interacts in a team environment. The second part was a likert interview. The likert interview allows current staff to get a better idea of an individual's personality. And the final part was the STAR interview. The STAR interview, which stands for Situation, Task, Action, and Result, are more behavioral type questions where the interviewers are looking for one to tell a story from past experience. What was the situation, what was the task or what did the situation call for, what did one actually do about it, and what was the end outcome.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you responded to an emergency situation.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a in person interview with the HR coordinator. We discussed my resume and went over the different roles in the office. It was very casual and easy going.
Interview Questions: Why would I like to work here? How do I handle work conflicta

title: Student Information Tech Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Schedule a time to interview and then come in to meet with the office supervisor. The interview is very informal, but it pays to dress nicely and make a good impression
Interview Questions: What office skills do you posses

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter on the HR site.  Once my cover letter got referred to department by HR, I contacted the department and let them know again of my interest in the position.  I then heard from them a couple weeks later for an interview.  I came in for an interview and within a week had a job offer from them.
Interview Questions: They asked me about research that I have gathered and analyzed.  Thankfully, for my senior project I had collected data using Survey Monkey and then analyzed the data using SPSS.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: submitted my resume via online first, then send my official documents. Sent other documents for paper works and made an appointment for the interview. Attended 1:1 with the primary investigator and one of the co-workers showed me the data that I would be dealing with.
Interview Questions: How  the position would support my lifetime goal

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. They know who they want and come after you.
Interview Questions: Finding something that is not working properly

title: Student Book Organizer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I found this job at MSU myspartancareer website and I applied using the system. I than get a interview which was about half an hour long. I was asked general behavior questions, for instance, how would you work effectively to meet deadlines.I was also asked about experience of training others.
Interview Questions: If there's a chance to put you in charge of supervising others, how would you do?

title: Student Operations Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: You come in and fill out an application and then they will interview you on the spot or they will call you back in. Most students have a connection to someone on the staff or team in order to get an interview or to have even heard about the positions. It was a very relaxed interview and has more to do with people skills and work availability.
Interview Questions: How many hours a week can you work and can you work summers?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume to a friend who passed it on to the hiring manager. The hiring manager sent me an email to request time to interview. Since I did not live nearby, we first did a phone interview. I was asked to come on site a couple weeks later to interview in person. Both times, I interviewed with the hiring manager and project manager. They were both very nice during the process.
Interview Questions: What was my experience with project implementation?

title: Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: My process took approximately two months from application to offer. There were two in-person interviews, first with the team and one HR representative, and then a second with a larger group, which included the team, the director of the department and a senior HR officer. The first interview also included an editing/AP style test. They were very communicative every step of the way.
Interview Questions: What part of this position do you feel least qualified to perform?

title: International Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: group meeting, few behavioral questions answered by turn. Everyone answered the same questions in turn. You can answer first, which might increase some performance point. Easy question, interview last about 30 mins long.
Interview Questions: what will you do if your partner disagree with you

title: Corporate Counsel Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, three months with no news, then second interview, then five more months with no news while department said they were not sure of funding to hire.  Gave up waiting and took another job.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last similar position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: First of all, you have to be a graduate student of Michigan State University. Then you have to apply for the positions related to your major. Next step, the corresponding departments will schedule interview with you. My department firstly chose the skype interview to see if I am good enough to teach. Then based on my grades, they made the decision to give the offer
Interview Questions: What would you do if some students with disabilities asking something you could not accomodate at the end of semester?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Michigan State University
Interview Descriptions: not a regular job interview - applied for graduate program and completed the application process. after the application process is complete, i was intimated about my selection in 3 months time. along with that i received an offer letter for my graduate assistant-ship too.
Interview Questions: prepare a neat and simple statement of purpose that details your interests in the program that you are applying to. this helps the team of professors make a good judgement of your case.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was an average interview process and fairly short. There wasn't a phone screen for this particular role, it was just an in person interview. The recruiters were very friendly in the recruiting process and were also very responsive throughout the interview process.
Interview Questions: What has been your most significant failure?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Skype, we did a presentation on skype. It wasn't too bad. I just showed my work and we shared a screen. It was overall pretty good. Michigan State was a good place to work, excellent benefits, understanding people. I showed my research in the interview. They asked questions mostly about my research. The overall experience was pretty good.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three panel interview consisting of assistant directors and a manager with questions about current responsibilities and future goals. A  tour of the facility upon interview completion where I was introduced to other members of the organization.
Interview Questions: What have you implemented that alleviated a problem?

title: Elektroingenieur HF / Wirtschaftsingenieur NDS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with managers over several days, my work in the previous position was observed and reported on. Previous people who held that position were also consulted about whether they felt I was a prudent choice.
Interview Questions: How would you handle delegating unpopular policy to underlings?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was no application available nor opening for work, but I submitted my resume hoping to get my foot in the door.  I was asked in for an interview and received an opportunity to become an intern after that.  One year later I was asked to become an intern in my field in the same office.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: HP Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring moved at a glacial pace. Several hoops to jump through. Lots of forced smiles and extreme egos bouncing off one another. Interview consisted of teaching a class, tons of meetings, phony wine and dining at a cheap college hangout where the faculty members gossiped amongst themselves about their terrible students peccadilloes. Yes! at an interview!
Interview Questions: From a potential colleague: "How are you about handling an emotional crisis from students of a sexual nature?"

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for my position happened when I interviewed to be a grad student. I talked to several faculty members over the phone, then came in for an in-person meeting with the faculty members. They were very receptive to my questions and kept the process as transparent as possible. After accepting the offer, I did learn that my job was going to be pretty different from the description they had originally given me. I would ask for a written set of job requirements before accepting.
Interview Questions: What kind of research do I want to be doing in my time at MSU?

title: General Kitchen Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Later received an email about the position to see if I was still interested. Met with the hiring manager that asked a few general questions and filed out paperwork. After that I went to orientation and training. There wasn't much of an interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Visiting Instructor/Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (New York, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
relatively easy you have the ability to teach and research. just several questions on teaching and research. Where did you get your PhD. Are you able to teach ...
Usually, there are phone calls to ask you about 5 to 7 questions. Then, they will make decision and help you process other things.
Not too many questions on your family and your background.
Interview Questions: Normal questions are how many courses you have taught. What is your research topics.

title: Student Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview process since I've already worked with everyone in my department.
Interview Questions: Many "what would you do" questions for weird situations. But it's helpful because those situations do come up quite often.

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nice. I received a phone call from a supervisor stating that she wanted to set up an interview for the position on campus. She asked for my availability and we agreed on a time. We met and she asked me various questions. I wore a suit. You have to look professional and prepared. On the application when I applied, you had to write an essay about a certain topic but I believe that has changed over time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Web Interface Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring manager initially called for a phone screen asking three basic questions. Then followed up a week or two later asking to setup an on-site interview.  After three more weeks went in for the on-site interview which lasted around 2.5 hours. They followed up 3 weeks later with a rejection letter. 

Work culture seemed great. Employees seemed very satisfied with their work. Very professional and skilled organization.
Interview Questions: What project would you say you've been most successful at?

title: Research Associate/Post Doc Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied the research associate position by email, and got response about three days later. Then we scheduled a presentation in the MSU. The presentation and discussion would be 1~2 hours, and there are lots of questions about my previous research and projects. Then I visited the labs and talked with everyone about their projects, and had lunch with graduate students. The whole process was very nice.
Interview Questions: Describe your research projects

title: Grounds Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite easy.  I got connected to the Manager through a mutual friend and she asked more about me and my work ethic and if I had any experience with the various equipment.  Obviously I had run a lawn mower prior to that but after getting the job there was a lot of equipment I had never used.  The employees and management are more than happy to teach you and are very patient if you show the dedication.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was recommended by professor. No real interview process--just a conversation and discussion to determine general competencies, interests, and work ethic. My interests aligned with the professor's current projects so they placed me on the team and work began the following week. It was a cohort model, with older students teaching fledgling researchers. Upon proving myself, I moved up the ladder over the years.
Interview Questions: What are you most interested in researching?

title: Newsroom Receptionish Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I filled out and application and was called in the same day for an interview. During the interview I was asked questions based on my previous work history and was hired on the spot. I think they really needed someone to fill the position quickly. I was trained that same night and started work the next day!
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule like?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of a series of questions of which I was to answer with a situation I had faced the action I took on that task and the results of my actions.   There were a variety of questions that were rather general but dealt with many different topics like dealing with others, going above and beyond, and difficulties faced.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with someone you didn't see eye to eye with?

title: Videography Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: My experience interviewing for a job with the Production Operations department of WKAR at Michigan State University was an absolute nightmare. The interviewers came across as cold and hostile, and conducted themselves unprofessionally and inappropriately. Snide remarks were made about my qualifications for the position, as well as the work samples I had submitted, and an air of condescension permeated the entire process. It felt more like a trial than an interview, and I left absolutely dumbfounded as to why these people had acted that way. Regardless, I sent polite thank you letters to each of them immediately following the interview. I ended up never hearing back from them - not even a phone call or e-mail - and found out by checking online that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: You're an entry-level candidate; why should we consider you? (this question was posed despite the fact that my resume truthfully listed several years experience in the given field)

title: Residential Twch Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (Lansing, MI) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and was called to fill in an application. I was interviewed and immediately hired .
Interview Questions: how do you handle autistic, behaviorly challenged clients?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Go listen to professors research all day, and if you're lucky you may get to briefly describe any research that you have done in the past. If you ask questions and do not fall asleep, you will be fine. If you are interviewing as a prospective, you can pretty much consider yourself accepted
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my resume and several things in my personal statement.
Interview Questions: Any questions for us?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was about the research I was doing for my Masters thesis
Interview Questions: Describe what you are doing for your Master's thesis ?

title: Information Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: Asked a bunch of questions from the people working in the office. Once they finished all their questions they told me I was hired on the spot
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow  Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed on phone first. The interview was kind of mock and went ok. After that i came to Michigan for a personal interview which started with a dinner on the first night. Next day i gave a presentation followed by a panel discussion and group lunch.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and what are your strengths and weaknesses?
